title: [K-12] Science Simulation Curriculum Utilizing Micro-Instructional Design Engineering

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level science foundational knowledge and basic digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Customized simulation environments strengthening learners' scientific thinking via activity theory-based design

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 80% proficiency in problem-solving skills utilizing scientific concepts (e.g., chemical reactions, physics laws) in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can explain how to design and execute scientific inquiry processes using digital tools.
Learners evaluate their ability to analyze simulation results and apply them to real-world scientific phenomena.

resources: VR Equipment Set and Computer Lab

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
